column6: Developed a resume tailoring application in python for job applicants in the tech field.
column7: The application automatically builds a resume based on a user-created database and a job description, allowing users to obtain a resume tailored to the job description in under 10 seconds while keeping its content original.
column8: Received 20+ positive feedback and multiple bug/functionality reports during the first round of end-to-end tests.

column6: Developed a website where user can build their own calendar by scraping various sites for events, add ICal files, and manually set events in a project group of 3 people.
column7: Contributed in both the frontend and backend, single-handedly developed multiple pages of the website and the task identification function in the backend.

column6: Written a drifting physics engine in C# and a simple simgle-player game in Unity to test it.
column7: Models oversteering, understeering, four-wheel drift, and other scenarios.
column8: Learned to model physics behavior with code and the basics of C# and Unity.

column7: Participated in the CPhO physics camp as one of the top 15 physics students in Canada.
column8: Developed strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities through laboratory designing challenges and tests.

column3: Founder & Owner | Canadian Physics Students Community
column5: Founded the CPSC as a platform for physics enthusiasts around Canada to connect with eachothers.
column6: Organized the Canadian Open Physics Examination, a national open-book problem-solving oriented contenst with 143 participants, ensuring smooth coordination and timely execution.
